description: From Latin thyrsus, from Ancient Greek θύρσος (thúrsos). Doublet of thyrse and torso.

entries.meaning: A staff topped with a conical ornament, carried by Bacchus or his followers.
examples: In my hand I bear / The thyrsus, tipped with fragrant cones of pine.

entries.meaning: (botany) A species of inflorescence; a dense panicle, as in the lilac and horse-chestnut.
